Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (4 ll., beginnings lost) and verso (names of 16 witnesses). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Receipt of a loan of money borrowed by P-Hwn(?) of a woman Naamsese, to be repaid partly in corn & partly in money. ([...] receipt for dowry by husband to wife). Date lost ([...] Philopator or Epiphanes). Origin Fayum (?)".
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (diagr. B, no.3)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2745) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2745)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: discoloured, fractured, loss, frayed Black ink (abraded) Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth (loose) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
Acquisition notes: Purchased from M. Nahman. Cf. the additional sheets at the end of Thompson's MS Catalogue, titled "B.M. Nahman Papyri (1923)".
